description: From French bufoténine, from Latin bufo (“toad”) + ten- (uncertain element)  +‎ -ine.

entries.meaning: (organic chemistry) An alkaloid, found in the skins of some toads, related to serotonin.
examples: In the late 1950s Howard Fabing, a medical doctor, obtained permission to inject bufotenine intravenously into a number of inmates at the Ohio State Penitentiary.
